comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: A nice small collection here of the men involved in the Battles of Coronel and Falkland Islands. Von Spee was a bit of a fatalist and did not expect to make it home. His son died as well in the same battle on one of the cruisers sunk. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximilian_von_Spee

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.derrittmeister.com/productpages/40165.htm may be the same picture, which the seller describes as "This is a framed lithograph or newspaper photograph of Vizeadmiral Graf von Spee. " The photographer's name appears to be Urbahns, Kiel. The Washington herald., December 12, 1914, page 1 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045433/1914-12-12/ed-... looks to have used the same picture and the one of Sturdee uploaded in the same batch. And Warren sheaf., December 23, 1914, page 1 (Warren, Minnesota) chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn90059228/1914-12-23/ed-... used the same two pictures.

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: kilted cowboy and swanq: thank you for the full name and additional information on Adm. Von Spee.  We will update the data to include his full name.
